questions.question: What is the process called when a seed begins to sprout and grow?
What does 'deciduous' mean when describing a tree?
options: It produces cones instead of flowers
It grows only in tropical climates

questions.question: What is the 'stamen' in a flower?
options: The male reproductive organ that produces pollen
The stem that supports the flower

questions.question: What is a 'rhizome' in botany?
options: A horizontal underground stem that sends out roots and shoots

questions.question: What is 'transpiration' in plants?
options: The growth of roots toward water
The absorption of nutrients from soil
The loss of water vapor through leaves

questions.question: What does 'perennial' mean for a plant?
options: It lives for more than two years
It blooms only once then dies
It completes its life cycle in two years

questions.question: What is the 'pistil' of a flower?
What is a 'tuber' in botany?
options: A thickened underground part of a stem used for storage
A flower that opens at night

questions.question: What is the 'cambium' layer in a tree?
options: The root cap at the tip of roots
The thin layer of growing tissue between bark and wood

questions.question: What does 'annual' mean when describing a plant?
options: It sheds leaves once a year
It produces fruit once a year
It blooms every year in the same season
It completes its entire life cycle in one growing season

questions.question: What is 'propagation' in gardening?
options: The process of creating new plants from existing ones
Removing dead flowers from a plant

questions.question: What is a 'succulent' plant known for?
options: Storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves or stems
